New Records: Shubman Gill scored his first T20I half century as T20I skipper in just 36 deliveries.
Key Match Events: Shubman Gill scored 66 runs, his first T20I half century as T20I skipper.
Ruturaj Gaikwad scored 49 off 28 deliveries, missing his half century by just one run.
Washington Sundar was named 'Player of the Match' for picking up three wickets.
Dion Myers scored an unbeaten 65 off 49 balls for Zimbabwe.
Clive Madande scored 37 off 26 balls for Zimbabwe.
Washington Sundar picked up three wickets, Avesh Khan took two wickets, and Khaleel Ahmed picked one for India.
Blessing Muzarabani and Sikandar Raza picked two wickets each for Zimbabwe.
Pre-Game Insights: Shubman Gill decided to bat first after winning the toss.
Yashasvi Jaiswal joined the India playing XI and opened for the team, scoring 36 off 27.
Shubman Gill's side was bolstered by the addition of World Cup-winning trio Yashasvi Jaiswal, Sanju Samson, and Shivam Dube.
Zimbabwe aimed to improve their batting performance after a 100-run defeat in the previous match.
Post-Match Reflections: Shubman Gill expressed satisfaction with the team's performance, highlighting the challenging wicket conditions.
Sikandar Raza acknowledged fielding issues and emphasized the need for senior players to step up.
Washington Sundar expressed his delight at being named 'Player of the Match' and praised the team's batting performance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at Harare Sports Ground.
India now leads the 5-match T20I series by 2-1.
The fourth T20I of the series is scheduled for 13 July, and the fifth for 14 July.
